monsters.name: Walter, the Graveborn
monsters.languages: Understands Common, but can't speak it
monsters.cr: 4, or 3 when its ***heavy sleeper*** feature is active

traits.name: Heavy Sleeper
traits.desc: If either of the mound’s forms has been unconscious within the past minute, it can’t use its ***tentacle*** attack more than once per turn.

traits.name: Oozing Body
traits.desc: The flesh mound can move through spaces occupied by enemy creatures, as well as spaces smaller than a Large creature. (It can't end its turn inside an occupied space, and it provokes opportunity attacks normally.)

traits.name: Innocent Heart
traits.desc: The center of the mound conceals its heart: a large, misshapen rib cage. Within the rib cage hovers the infant corpse of Walter Durst. Walter's corpse has AC 15 and the same ability scores as the flesh mound. Each time Walter's corpse takes damage, the flesh mound takes twice as much damage.

traits.name: Mother's Lullaby
traits.desc: If a player uses their action to hum or play Waltz for Klara and succeeds on a DC 10 Charisma (Performance) check, the mound exposes its heart and can't use its withdraw reaction until the start of the player's next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The flesh mound makes three attacks, or two attacks if its heavy sleeper feature is active.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage if the mound's heavy sleeper. feature is active. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 15 feet toward the mound.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Gore Spray
bonus_actions.desc: The mound spews blood and gore in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 7 (2d6) necrotic damage and is blinded until the end of the mound's next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded. Using this ability exposes the mound's heart, allowing it to be attacked.

bonus_actions.name: Wail
bonus_actions.desc: The infant corpse of Walter Durst releases a piercing shriek. Each creature that can hear the shriek within 30 feet of the mound must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take 2 (1d4) psychic damage and be deafened until the end of the mound's next turn. Using this ability exposes the mound's heart, allowing it to be attacked.

reactions.name: Multireaction
reactions.desc: The flesh mound can take up to three reactions per round, though no more than one per turn. If it would lose its reactions, it loses one reaction instead.

reactions.name: Withdraw
reactions.desc: In response to an attack or harmful spell hitting or missing its heart, the mound withdraws its heart into its body, concealing it from view and protecting it from attacks.

reactions.name: Lash Out
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage from a melee attack, the mound lashes out at the attacker with a tentacle. The attacker must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away. If the attacker fails the saving throw by 5 or more, they also fall prone.

reactions.name: Roll
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage from a ranged attack or spell, the mound moves up to its speed directly toward or away from the attacker without provoking opportunity attacks. If it moves toward the attacker, it can then immediately attempt to shove them.

monsters.name: Poltergeist
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious
monsters.languages: any languages it knew in life

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The poltergeist can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Invisibility
traits.desc: The poltergeist is invisible.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the poltergeist has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Forceful Slam.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) force damage.

actions.name: Telekinetic Thrust
actions.desc: The poltergeist targets a creature or unattended object within 30 feet of it.  A creature must be Medium or smaller to be affected by this magic, and an object can weigh up to 150 pounds.  If the target is a creature, the poltergeist makes a Charisma check contested by the target's Strength check.  If the poltergeist wins the contest, the poltergeist hurls the target up to 30 feet in any direction, including upward.  If the target then comes into contact with a hard surface or heavy object, the target takes 1d6 damage per 10 feet moved.  If the target is an object that isn't being worn or carried, the poltergeist hurls it up to 30 feet in any direction.  The poltergeist can use the object as a ranged weapon, attacking one creature along the object's path (+4 to hit) and dealing 5 (2d4) bludgeoning damage on a hit.

traits.name: Reckless
traits.desc: At the start of its turn, the berserker can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) piercing damage.

traits.name: Tail Spike Regrowth
traits.desc: The Greater Strix has twenty-four clusters of silver barbs growing from its wings. Used barbs regrow when the Greater Strix finishes a long rest.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Greater Strix makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws or three with its silver barbs.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Silver barbs
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 100/200 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage. These are considered a Silvered Weapon.

monsters.name: Swarm of Lesser Strix
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Swarm
traits.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny crow. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

actions.name: Beaks
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 7 (2d6) piercing damage, or 3 (1d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

monsters.name: The Nightmare Three
monsters.subtype: trio of one medium fiend and two huge fiends
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered
monsters.cr: 15, or 13 when fought with silvered weapons

traits.name: Hag Coven
traits.desc: The coven includes three hags: Morgantha, Bella, and Offalia. If the coven is reduced to 0 hit points, all hags die. Until then, a hag acts on her own initiative, suffers conditions independently, and has her own action, bonus action, reaction, and movement. Any damage a hag takes is subtracted from the coven's hit points.

traits.name: Nightmare Forms
traits.desc: In this phase, Bella assumes the form of a Huge crocodile, Offalia assumes the form of a Huge elephant, and Morgantha is surrounded by a shroud of swirling shadows.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The coven has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

traits.name: Charge (Offalia Only)
traits.desc: If Offalia moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 11 (2d10) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

actions.name: Bite (Bella Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage and the target is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and Bella can't bite another target.

actions.name: Tail (Bella Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target not grappled by Bella. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Gore (Offalia Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Eyebite (Morgantha Only)
actions.desc: Morgantha casts or uses eyebite (DC 17). A target that succeeds on the saving throw is dazed until the end of its next turn. A dazed creature can move or take one action on its turn, not both. It also can’t take a bonus action or a reaction.

bonus_actions.name: Tail Swipe (Bella Only)
bonus_actions.desc: Bella swipes her tail in a 10-foot cone. Each creature within that area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage and falling prone on a failure. A creature that succeeds takes half damage and doesn't fall prone.

bonus_actions.name: Hallucinatory Mist (Bella Only)
bonus_actions.desc: Bella sprays a 30-foot cone of pearlescent mist. Each creature within the mist must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be dazed until the start of Bella's next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Stomp (Offalia Only)
bonus_actions.desc: Offalia stomps the ground around her. Each creature within a 5-foot radius must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 (2d10) bludgeoning damage on a failure, or half as much on a success.

bonus_actions.name: Fiend's Trumpet (Offalia Only)
bonus_actions.desc: Offalia releases a sonorous trumpet from her trunk. Each humanoid creature within a 60-foot radius must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or subtract 1d4 from their next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.

bonus_actions.name: Enervating Ring (Morgantha Only)
bonus_actions.desc: Tendrils of inky darkness reach out from Morgantha, touching each creature within 10 feet. Each target must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or take 9 (2d8) necrotic damage and be slowed until the end of its next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Inflict Nightmares (Morgantha Only)
bonus_actions.desc: Morgantha conjures a cloud of ethereal mist around a creature she can see within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until it takes damage or another creature uses its action to shake them awake. The creature takes 9 (2d8) psychic damage at the end of its turn if it's still stunned.

reactions.name: Tail Lash (Bella Only)
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage from a creature within 10 feet, Bella makes a tail attack against her attacker.

reactions.name: Tusks (Offalia Only)
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage from a melee attack, Offalia makes a gore attack against her attacker.

reactions.name: Shadow Step (Morgantha Only)
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage from a creature she can see, Morgantha takes half as much damage (rounded down) and teleports up to 30 feet.

reactions.name: Matron's Rebuke (Morgantha Only)
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage from a creature within 60 feet that she can see, Morgantha points and surrounds the attacker with writhing shadows. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or take 11 (2d10) necrotic damage.

reactions.name: Absorb Elements (Any)
reactions.desc: In response to taking acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, the hag casts absorb elements.

monsters.name: Muriel Vinshaw
monsters.speed: 30 ft. (fly 50ft in raven and hybrid forms)

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Muriel regains 10 hit points at the start of her turn if she hasn't taken necrotic damage or bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage from a silvered weapon since her last turn. She dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Mimic
traits.desc: Muriel can mimic simple sounds she has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 10 Wisdom (Insight) check.

traits.name: Plummet
traits.desc: If Muriel flies at least 20 feet straight toward a target while descending at least five feet toward the ground, and then hits that target with a shortsword attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Muriel makes two weapon attacks, one of which can be with her hand crossbow.

actions.name: Shortsword (Raven or Hybrid Form Only).
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Beak (Raven or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage in raven form, or 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage in hybrid form. If the target is humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wereraven lycanthropy.

bonus_actions.name: Shapechange
bonus_actions.desc: Muriel polymorphs into a raven-humanoid hybrid or into a raven, or back into her human form. Its statistics, other than her size, are the same in each form. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. She reverts back to her human form if she dies.

reactions.name: Interpose
reactions.desc: When a creature Muriel can see hits another target within 5 feet of Muriel with an attack, she can use her reaction to take the damage instead.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
traits.desc: The scout has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The scout makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, ranged 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Pitchfork
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d6) piercing damage.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.desc: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Maul
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the wolf can grapple the target (escape DC 11).

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must make a DC 11 Strength saving throw. On a failure, it is knocked prone or pushed 5 feet away (wolf's choice).

monsters.name: Barovian Werewolf
monsters.ac: 11 in humanoid form, 12 (natural armor) in wolf or hybrid form

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.desc: The werewolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The werewolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the werewolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The werewolf regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the werewolf takes necrotic damage or bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage from a silvered weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of the werewolf's next turn. The werewolf dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The werewolf makes two attacks: two with its spear (humanoid form) or one with its bite and one with its claws (wolf or hybrid form).

actions.name: Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the werewolf can grapple the target (escape DC 11.) Additionally, if the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werewolf lycanthropy.

actions.name: Claws (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Spear (Humanoid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

bonus_actions.name: Shapechange
bonus_actions.desc: The werewolf polymorphs into a wolf-humanoid hybrid or into a wolf, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying melds into the new form. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

monsters.name: Barovian Zombie
monsters.languages: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

traits.name: Undead Fortitude (1/day)
traits.desc: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead. The zombie can’t use this ability if the damage is radiant or from a critical hit, if the damage taken is 15 or more, or if it had only 1 hit point remaining.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Barovian Zombie Plague Spreader
monsters.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Undead Fortitude (1/day)
traits.desc: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, the plague spreader drops to 1 hit point instead. The plague spreader can’t use this ability if the damage is radiant or from a critical hit, if the damage taken is 15 or more, or if it had only 1 hit point remaining.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The zombie plague spreader doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Viral Aura
traits.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the plague spreader must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is poisoned and can’t regain hit points until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this plague spreader’s Viral Aura for 24 hours.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The plague spreader makes two Slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 5 (1d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Virulent Miasma (1/Day)
actions.desc:
The plague spreader releases toxic gas in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
A humanoid reduced to 0 hit points by this damage doesn’t automatically die. However, if it dies before stabilizing or regaining hit points, it rises as a zombie (see the Monster Manual) 1 minute later. The DC for death saving throws made by such a creature to stabilize increases to 20. The new zombie acts immediately after the plague spreader in the initiative count.

monsters.name: The Flesh Mound
monsters.languages: Understands Common, but can't speak it
monsters.cr: 4, or 3 when its ***heavy sleeper*** feature is active

traits.name: Heavy Sleeper
traits.desc: If either of the mound’s forms has been unconscious within the past minute, it can’t use its ***slam*** attack more than once per turn.

traits.name: Oozing Body
traits.desc: The flesh mound can move through spaces occupied by enemy creatures, as well as spaces smaller than a Large creature. (It can't end its turn inside an occupied space, and it provokes opportunity attacks normally.)

traits.name: Instinctual Defense
traits.desc: When the mound drops to 0 hit points, it expels each creature currently engulfed by it. (Those creatures appear prone in an empty space within 5 feet of the mound.) The mound’s statistics are then instantly replaced by the statistics of its second form. Its initiative count doesn’t change. Excess damage doesn't carry over to its new form, but it retains any conditions it had in its previous form.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The flesh mound makes two attacks. It can replace one of those attacks with engulf. If its heavy sleeper feature is active, it can't use its slam attack more than once, and it can't use engulf on the same turn it uses its slam.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage, or 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage if the mound's heavy sleeper. feature is active. If the attack hits a Medium or smaller target, the target is grappled (escape DC 13).

actions.name: Bone Splinters
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 20/60 ft., up to two targets standing within 5 ft. of each other. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Engulf
actions.desc: The flesh mound attempts to engulf a Medium or smaller creature grappled by it, forcing that creature to make a DC 13 Strength saving throw. On a failure, the engulfed target is blinded, restrained, and unable to breathe, and it must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw at the start of each of its turns or take 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the mound moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The mound can only have one creature engulfed at a time. An engulfed creature can make a DC 13 Strength saving throw at the end of each of its turns, freeing itself on a success. (Once freed, the creature is no longer grappled.)

bonus_actions.name: Rupture
bonus_actions.desc: The flesh mound expels a pustule of rotting flesh, which hits a point within 20 feet of the mound and bursts, spraying each creature within 5 feet with caustic blood and pus. A target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the flesh mound's next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Quake
bonus_actions.desc: The flesh mound slams against the floor, causing the room to quake. Each creature within 10 feet of the mound must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or fall prone.

reactions.name: Multireaction
reactions.desc: The flesh mound can take up to three reactions per round, though no more than one per turn. If it would lose its reactions, it loses one reaction instead.

reactions.name: Squelch
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage from a melee attack, the flesh mound attempts to grapple the attacker using their ***Slam.***

reactions.name: Roll
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage from a ranged attack or spell, the flesh mound moves up to its speed directly toward or away from the attacker without provoking opportunity attacks. If it moves toward the attacker, it can then immediately attempt to shove them.

monsters.name: Volenta, First Form
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Close Quarters Fighter
traits.desc: Volenta doesn't have disadvantage on her ranged attack rolls when within 5 feet of a hostile creature.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Volenta regains 10 hit points at the start of her turn if she has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If Volenta takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of her next turn.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: Volenta can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, Volenta takes 20 radiant damage at the start of her turn, and she has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

traits.name: Nimble Escape
traits.desc: Volenta can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of her turns.

traits.name: Awakened Bloodlust
traits.desc: When Volenta drops to 0 hit points, her nostrils flare like a bats, her claws lengthen, and her eyes begin to glow a dim crimson. Her statistics are then instantly replaced by the statistics of her second form. Her initiative count doesn't change. Excess damage doesn't carry over to her new form, but she retains any conditions she had in her previous form.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Volenta uses hail of daggers twice, dagger twice, or hail of daggers once and either tanglefoot or thunderstone.

actions.name: Hail of Daggers
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 15 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tanglefoot (1/day)
actions.desc: Volenta hurls a bag of writhing, sticky black tar at a point on the ground within 30 feet. The bag bursts on impact, covering up to two creatures within 5 feet of one another with sticky tar and forcing each target to succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be restrained. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

actions.name: Thunderstone (1/day)
actions.desc: Volenta hurls a crystalline shard at a creature, object, or surface within 30 feet. The shard shatters on impact with a blast of concussive energy. Each creature within 10 feet of the point of impact must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be knocked prone and pushed 10 feet away from that point. A creature that fails the save is also deafened until the start of Volenta’s next turn.

actions.name: Alchemist's Firebomb (1/day)
actions.desc: Volenta hurls a flask of concentrated alchemist's fire at a point within 30 feet. The vial shatters on impact and detonates in a 10-foot radius. Any creature in that area must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 fire damage and be set ablaze. A creature set ablaze in this way takes 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns, and can make an additional DC 14 Dexterity saving throw at the end of each of its turns to extinguish the flames.

reactions.name: Smokestick (1/day)
reactions.desc: When Volenta is reduced to 0 hit points, if she isn't grappled, restrained, or incapacitated, she can crack a charred, black wooden stick, releasing a cloud of thick, opaque smoke that creates a heavily obscured area in a 20-foot radius. She can then move up to her speed without triggering opportunity attacks. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the smoke in 4 rounds; a strong wind (20 or more miles per hour) disperses it in 1 round.

monsters.name: Volenta, Second Form
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Close Quarters Fighter
traits.desc: Volenta doesn't have disadvantage on her ranged attack rolls when within 5 feet of a hostile creature.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Volenta regains 10 hit points at the start of her turn if she has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If Volenta takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of her next turn.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: Volenta can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, Volenta takes 20 radiant damage at the start of her turn, and she has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: Volenta has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Volenta makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is grappled by Volenta, incapacitated, or restrained. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and Volenta regains hit points equal to that amount. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. Each time the target finishes a long rest without being bitten again, it can roll one of its hit dice and add its Constitution modifier. The target’s maximum hit points increase by an amount equal to the result. (This increase can’t raise the target’s hit points above its original maximum.)

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, Volenta can grapple the target (escape DC 13).

bonus_actions.name: Leap
bonus_actions.desc: Volenta moves up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks. As she does, she can replace 10 feet of movement with a 10-foot high jump.

bonus_actions.name: Dislocate
bonus_actions.desc: Volenta dislocates her joints, automatically escaping any nonmagical restraints, such as manacles or a creature that has her grappled.

reactions.name: Multireaction
reactions.desc: Volenta can take up to three reactions per round, but only one per turn. If Volenta would lose her reactions, she loses one reaction instead.

reactions.name: Spit Blood
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage from a melee attack, Volenta spits a wad of blood at the attacking creature’s eyes, forcing it to make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the creature is blinded until the end of its next turn.

reactions.name: Agress
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage from an attack or spell, Volenta moves up to her speed toward a hostile creature she can see without provoking opportunity attacks.

reactions.name: Abscond
reactions.desc: In response to escaping a grapple, Volenta uses her leap feature.

monsters.name: Doru, the Vampire Spawn
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Doru regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If Doru takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of Doru's next turn.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: Doru can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Vampire Weaknesses
traits.desc:
Doru has the following vampiric flaws:
Forbiddance. Doru can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
Harmed by Running Water. Doru takes 20 acid damage when it ends its turn in running water.
Stake to the Heart. Doru is destroyed if a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into its heart while it is incapacitated in its resting place.
Sunlight Hypersensitivity. Doru takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Doru makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is grappled by Doru, incapacitated, or restrained. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and Doru regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, Doru can grapple the target (escape DC 13).

traits.name: Healer
traits.desc:
Ireena is an able physician, allowing her to mend wounds quickly and get her allies back in the fight. She gains the following benefits:
When Ireena uses a healer's kit to stabilize a dying creature, that creature also regains 1 hit point.
As an action, Ireena can spend one use of a healer's kit to tend to a creature and restore 1d6 + 4 hit points to it, plus additional hit points equal to the creature's maximum number of Hit Dice. The creature can't regain hit points from this feat again until it finishes a short or long rest.

actions.name: Rapier
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 90/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Helpful
bonus_actions.desc: Ireena is adept at giving well-timed assistance; She can take the Help action as a bonus action.

bonus_actions.name: Cunning Action
bonus_actions.desc: Ireena's quick thinking allows her to act speedily. On her turn in combat, she can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action as a bonus action.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: Ireena adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit her. To do so, Ireena must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Ismark makes two longsword attacks. If he has a shortsword drawn, he can also make a shortsword attack.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Heavy Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) piercing damage.

traits.name: Exhaustion Level 4
traits.desc:
Kolyan's old age has taken its toll. He suffers from the following effects:
- Disadvantage on ability checks
- Speed halved
- Disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws
- Hit point maximum halved

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Kolyan makes two longsword attacks. If he has a shortsword drawn, he can also make a shortsword attack.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Heavy Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) piercing damage.

traits.name: Manifest Finger
traits.desc: Once per round, Elisabeth Durst manifests a spindly elongated claw reaching from beneath the house through the chimneys. It emerges from any hearth or smashes from closed chimney sections, before reaching out towards the closest player. While manifested, the claw remains connected to where it emerged from via a gaunt, too-many-elbowed arm that extends up to 30ft.

traits.name: Persistant Spectre
traits.desc: If Elisabeth's Claw is defeated it desolves into drifts of harmless spiderwebs, however Elisabeth manifests this claw anew at the start of its turn.

traits.name: Trapped Spirit
traits.desc: Elisabeth Durst's Spirit is bound to Death House's Dungeon. As a result, her claws are unable to leave the property. If they attempt to, they hit what appears to be a spiritual barrier at the Entrance (1).

actions.name: Grasping Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach within 15 ft. of a Hearth or closed chimney section, one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage, and the target is Grappled by Elisabeth's Claw (Escape DC 12.)

bonus_actions.name: Drag Inside
bonus_actions.desc: While Grappling a creature, Elisabeth's Claw can attempt to drag the grappled creature towards where it emerged from. When it does so, the creature must succeed on a DC 12 Strength Saving Throw or be forcefully pulled 15ft towards where Elisabeth's Claw emerged from.

reactions.name: Drag Beneath
reactions.desc: While a creature grappled by Elisabeth's Claw occupies the space 5ft from where it emerged from, Elisabeth's Claw can use its reaction at the end of that creature's turn to drag them deeper into Death House. When it does so, the creature must succeed on a DC 12 Strength Saving Throw or be forcefully pulled 1 floor deeper into the nearest unoccupied space on that floor. If they are on the First Floor of Death House, they instead take 1d6 bludgeoning damage as the Claw tries to drag them forcefully through the solid stone at the base of the chimney.

monsters.name: Broom of Animated Attack
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 7

traits.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
traits.desc: The broom is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the broom must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

traits.name: Constructed Nature
traits.desc: An animated object doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep. The magic that animates an object is dispelled when the construct drops to 0 hit points. An animated object reduced to 0 hit points becomes inanimate and is too damaged to be of much use or value to anyone.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The broom makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

reactions.name: Animated Attack
reactions.desc: If the broom is motionless and a creature grabs hold of it, the broom makes a Dexterity check contested by the creature's Strength check. If the broom wins the contest, it flies out of the creature's grasp and makes a melee attack against it with advantage on the attack roll.

monsters.name: Father Lucian

traits.name: Divine Eminence
traits.desc: As a reaction when he sees another creature within 30 feet hit with a weapon attack, Father Lucian can expend a spell slot to cause that attack to magically deal an extra 10 (3d6) radiant damage to a target on a hit. If Father Lucian expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d6 for each level above 1st.

actions.name: Mace
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

spells: Father Lucian is a 5th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). Father Lucian has the following cleric spells prepared:

monsters.name: Scarlet
monsters.damage_resistances: Bludgeoning, Slashing, and Piercing while raging

traits.name: Screams of the Dead
traits.desc: Any creature within 10 feet of Rahadin that isn't protected by a *mind blank* spell hears in its mind the screams of the thousands of people Rahadin has killed.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: Rahadin has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put him to sleep.

traits.name: Mask of the Wild
traits.desc: Rahadin can attempt to hide even when he is only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, or other natural phenomena.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Rahadin makes three attacks with his scimitars Thorn and/or Chain. He can replace one attack with his Haunt feature.

actions.name: Thorn
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d6 + 6) slashing damage, and Rahadin can force the target to make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or bleed for the next 1 minute. A bleeding target must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw at the start of each of its turns or take 1d6 slashing damage. On a success or upon receiving magical healing, the target is no longer bleeding.

actions.name: Chain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d6 + 6) slashing damage, and Rahadin can force the target to make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. If the target fails by 5 or more, it also falls prone.

actions.name: Haunt
actions.desc: Rahadin forces a creature he can see within 30 feet to succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or take 7 (2d6) psychic damage and be frightened and deafened by shrieking souls until the start of his next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Deathly Choir
bonus_actions.desc: Each creature within 10 feet of Rahadin that isn't protected by a *mind blank* spell must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw, taking 9 (2d8) psychic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. If a creature fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also frightened until the start of Rahadin's next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Swift Step
bonus_actions.desc: Rahadin takes the Dash or Disengage action.

reactions.name: Multiple Reactions
reactions.desc: Rahadin can take up to three reactions per round, though no more than one per turn. If Rahadin would lose his reactions, he loses one reaction instead.

reactions.name: Indomitable
reactions.desc: Trigger: A hostile creature ends its turn. Effect: Rahadin can repeat the saving throw against one effect or condition currently affecting him. (This reaction has no effect if the effect or condition didn’t originally require it to fail a saving throw.)

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: Rahadin adds +5 to his Armor Class against one melee or ranged attack that would hit him or to the result of a failed Dexterity saving throw, or takes no damage from *magic missile* this turn. If he causes a melee attack to miss in this way, he can then immediately use an additional reaction, if available, to use his Riposte against the attacker.

reactions.name: Riposte
reactions.desc: When an enemy misses Rahadin with a melee attack, he can use his reaction to move up to his speed to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of that enemy without triggering opportunity attacks. He can then immediately make an attack with Thorn or Chain against that enemy with advantage.

traits.name: Screams of the Dead
traits.desc: Any creature within 10 feet of Rahadin that isn't protected by a *mind blank* spell hears in its mind the screams of the thousands of people Rahadin has killed.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: Rahadin has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put him to sleep.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
Rahadin's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
  • 3/day: *phantom steed*
  • 1/day: *nondetection*

traits.name: Mask of the Wild
traits.desc: Rahadin can attempt to hide even when he is only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, or other natural phenomena.

traits.name: Murderous Instinct
traits.desc: When Rahadin drops to 0 hit points, he stows his saber and draws his twin scimitars, Thorn and Chain. His statistics are then instantly replaced by the statistics of his second form. His initiative count doesn't change. Excess damage doesn't carry over to his new form, and he doesn’t retain any conditions he had in his previous form.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Rahadin makes two attacks.

actions.name: Saber
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d8 + 6) slashing damage, and Rahadin can push the target up to 5 feet away. Instead of pushing the target, Rahadin can force it to succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Poisoned Dart
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (1d4 + 6 plus 2d4) piercing and poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of Rahadin's next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Wind Strike
bonus_actions.desc: Rahadin moves up to his speed in a straight line toward an unoccupied space he can see, including through enemy spaces, without provoking opportunity attacks. Each creature within 5 feet of a space he passes through must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus_actions.name: Whirling Blades
bonus_actions.desc: Each creature within 10 feet of Rahadin must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reactions.name: Multiple Reactions
reactions.desc: Rahadin can take up to three reactions per round, though no more than one per turn. If Rahadin would lose his reactions, he loses one reaction instead.

reactions.name: Indomitable
reactions.desc: Trigger: A hostile creature ends its turn. Effect: Rahadin can repeat the saving throw against one effect or condition currently affecting him. (This reaction has no effect if the effect or condition didn’t originally require it to fail a saving throw.)

reactions.name: Punishing Strike
reactions.desc: When Rahadin is hit by a melee or ranged attack, he can use his reaction to move up to his speed toward the attacker and make an attack with his saber. This movement doesn't trigger opportunity attacks.

reactions.name: Disarm
reactions.desc: When an enemy misses Rahadin with a melee attack while wielding a weapon, he can use his reaction to force that enemy to make a DC 19 Strength saving throw, with advantage if the enemy is holding the weapon with two hands. On a failure, the enemy drops the item, which is knocked 10 feet away.

reactions.name: Misty Step (1/round)
reactions.desc: When an enemy misses Rahadin with an attack or deals damage to him, he can use his reaction to cast *misty step*. He can then immediately take the Hide action. Rahadin doesn't need to see his destination when casting *misty step* in this way.

reactions.name: Psychic Scream (1/day)
reactions.desc: When Rahadin is reduced to 0 hit points, he can use his reaction to cause his deathly choir to release a terrible scream. Each creature within 60 feet of Rahadin must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw, taking 11 (2d10) psychic damage on a failed save or half as much on a success. If a creature fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also stunned until the start of Rahadin's next turn.

monsters.name: The Bonegrinder Coven
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered
monsters.cr: 14, or 12 when fought with silvered weapons

traits.name: Hag Coven
traits.desc: The coven includes three hags: Morgantha, Bella, and Offalia. A hag acts on her own initiative, keeps concentration and suffers conditions independently, and has her own action, bonus action, reaction, and movement. Any damage a hag takes is subtracted from the coven's hit points. (If multiple hags take damage from the same source, the coven loses hit points that many times.)

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The coven has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.desc: The coven's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks).

traits.name: Complex Casting
traits.desc: If a hag casts a spell on her turn using a bonus action, she can also use her action to cast a non-cantrip spell on the same turn.

traits.name: Second Phase
traits.desc: If the coven is reduced to 0 hit points, its statistics are instantly replaced by those of **The Nightmare Three**. Its initiative remains the same. Excess damage doesn't carry over to its new form, but it retains any conditions it had in its previous form.

actions.name: Blindness/Deafness (Bella Only)
actions.desc: Bella casts blindness/deafness. A target takes an additional 7 (2d6) necrotic damage if it fails the saving throw, or half damage on a success.

actions.name: Putrid Radiance (Bella Only)
actions.desc: 2nd-level necromancy, 30 feet. Dim, greenish light bursts within a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point that Bella chooses within range. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or take 2d6 radiant damage and be poisoned until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Ray of Enfeeblement (Offalia Only)
actions.desc: Offalia casts ray of enfeeblement. A target takes an additional 9 (2d8) necrotic damage on a hit.

actions.name: Acid Arrow (Offalia Only)
actions.desc: Offalia casts Melf's acid arrow.

actions.name: Ray of Sickness (Morgantha Only)
actions.desc: Morgantha casts ray of sickness.

actions.name: Withering Rot (Morgantha Only)
actions.desc: 1st-level necromancy, 30 feet. Necromantic energy washes over a creature of Morgantha's choice within range, which must make a Constitution saving throw. The target takes 13 (3d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

actions.name: Claws (Any)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Crown of Madness (Bella Only)
bonus_actions.desc: Bella casts crown of madness. A target takes an additional 5 (2d4) psychic damage if it fails the saving throw, or half damage on a success. Bella can use her bonus action to maintain control rather than her action.

bonus_actions.name: Phantasmal Force (Bella Only)
bonus_actions.desc: Bella casts phantasmal force. A target takes an additional 5 (2d4) psychic damage if it fails the saving throw, or half damage on a success.

bonus_actions.name: Cause Fear (Offalia Only)
bonus_actions.desc: Offalia casts cause fear at 2nd level. A target takes an additional 5 (2d4) psychic damage if it fails the saving throw, or half damage on a success.

bonus_actions.name: Bestow Curse (Offalia Only)
bonus_actions.desc: Offalia casts bestow curse at 30 feet. A target takes an additional 7 (2d6) necrotic damage if it fails the saving throw, or half damage on a success.

bonus_actions.name: Hold Person (Morgantha Only)
bonus_actions.desc: Morgantha casts hold person at 3rd level. A target takes an additional 5 (2d4) necrotic damage if it fails the saving throw, or half damage on a success.

bonus_actions.name: Lightning Bolt (Morgantha Only, Recharge 5-6)
bonus_actions.desc: Morgantha casts lightning bolt.

reactions.name: Spectral Shadows (Bella Only)
reactions.desc: 1st-level illusion, self. In response to being hit by an attack, Bella conjures two illusory duplicates. The attacker must roll a d6, hitting Bella on a 5–6 or hitting a duplicate otherwise.

reactions.name: Maniacal Mirth (Offalia Only)
reactions.desc: 1st-level enchantment, 30 feet. In response to taking damage from a creature she can see, Offalia forces that creature to make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it falls prone, becomes incapacitated, and laughs uncontrollably until the end of its next turn or until it takes damage.

reactions.name: Witchlight Arc (Morgantha Only)
reactions.desc: 1st-level evocation, 30 feet. In response to taking damage from a creature she can see, Morgantha forces that creature to make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or take 6 (1d12) lightning damage. On a failure, a crackling arc connects Morgantha and the attacker until the start of her next turn. While the arc lasts, Morgantha has resistance to all damage, and each time she takes damage, the connected creature takes the same amount.

reactions.name: Misty Step (Any)
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage, a hag can use her reaction to cast misty step.

monsters.name: Zombie Plague Spreader
monsters.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.desc: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Viral Aura
traits.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the plague spreader must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is poisoned and can’t regain hit points until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this plague spreader’s Viral Aura for 24 hours.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The plague spreader makes two Slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 5 (1d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Virulent Miasma (1/Day)
actions.desc:
The plague spreader releases toxic gas in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
A humanoid reduced to 0 hit points by this damage doesn’t automatically die. However, if it dies before stabilizing or regaining hit points, it rises as a zombie (see the Monster Manual) 1 minute later. The DC for death saving throws made by such a creature to stabilize increases to 20. The new zombie acts immediately after the plague spreader in the initiative count.

monsters.name: Strahd, the Mage
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.languages: Abyssal, Common, Draconic, Elvish, Giant, Infernal

traits.name: Close Quarters Fighter
traits.desc: Strahd doesn't have disadvantage on his ranged attack rolls when within 5 feet of a hostile creature.

traits.name: Complex Casting
traits.desc: If Strahd casts a spell on his turn using a bonus action, he can also use his action to cast a leveled spell on the same turn

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Strahd regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 hit point and isn’t in sunlight. If he takes radiant damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of his next turn.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: Strahd can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving his hands free.

traits.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, Strahd takes 20 radiant damage at the start of his turn, and he has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

traits.name: Fast Grappler
traits.desc: Strahd does not have to spend extra movement to move a creature grappled by him if the grappled creature is the same size or smaller.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc: Strahd's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence. He can innately cast the following spells: 3/day - detect thoughts, animate dead, 1/day - scrying

traits.name: Undead Nature
traits.desc: Strahd doesn't require air.

traits.name: Forbiddance
traits.desc: Strahd can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

traits.name: Chained to the Grave
traits.desc: Strahd cannot gain the benefits of a long rest except by resting in his coffin for eight consecutive hours between dawn and dusk.

traits.name: Children of the Night
traits.desc: Strahd can comprehend and verbally communicate with Barovian bats, rats, and wolves (including dire wolves), which obey his commands.

traits.name: Stake to the Heart
traits.desc: If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into Strahd’s heart while he is incapacitated in his coffin, he is paralyzed until the stake is removed.

traits.name: Dominion of the Mountain
traits.desc: While Strahd retains the power of the Mountain Fane, he is under the effect of a permanent nondetection spell.

traits.name: Dominion of the Swamp
traits.desc: While Strahd retains the power of the Swamp Fane, he can cast major image and move earth without components.

traits.name: Dominion of the Forest
traits.desc: While Strahd retains the power of the Forest Fane, he can cast beast sense and locate creature without components.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.desc: If Strahd is destroyed while he retains the power of at least one of the Fanes, he gains a new body in 24 hours, regaining all his hit points and phases and becoming active again. His new body appears within his coffin.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Strahd uses vampiric touch twice, or vampiric touch and telekinetic grasp once each.

actions.name: Vampiric Touch
actions.desc: Strahd casts or attacks with vampiric touch (+12 to hit). Strahd makes a melee spell attack against a creature within his reach. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 necrotic damage, and Strahd regains hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt. Until the spell ends, Strahd can make the attack again on each of his turns as an action. A creature hit by an attack made with this spell must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or be dazed until the start of Strahd’s next turn. (That creature can move or take one action on its turn, not both. It also can’t take a bonus action or a reaction.)

actions.name: Telekinetic Grasp
actions.desc: 2nd-level transmutation, range 60 feet, components V S M, 1 round. Effect: Strahd exerts his will on one creature that he can see within 60 feet and forces it to make a DC 20 Strength saving throw. On a failure, that creature rises vertically, up to 20 feet, and remains suspended there until the start of Strahd’s next turn. That creature also takes 7 (2d6) necrotic damage and is restrained until the end of Strahd’s next turn. When the effect ends, the target falls to the ground if it is still aloft.

actions.name: Dispel Magic (3/day)
actions.desc: 3rd level abjuration, range 120 feet, components V, S, Instantaneous. Effect: Strahd chooses one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, Strahd makes an ability check using his spellcasting ability (+12). The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

bonus_actions.name: Circle of Sickness
bonus_actions.desc: 3rd-level necromancy, self, components V S M, instantaneous. Effect: A sphere of negative energy bursts from Strahd. Each creature within 10 feet of Strahd must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 28 (8d6) necrotic damage and gains disadvantage on its next attack roll made before the end of its next turn. A creature that succeeds on the roll takes half damage and doesn’t gain disadvantage.

bonus_actions.name: Lightning Bolt
bonus_actions.desc: Strahd casts Lightning Bolt (DC 20). 3rd-level evocation, range Self (100-foot line), components V S M, Instantaneous. Effect: A stroke of lightning forming a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts out from Strahd in a direction he chooses. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 20). A creature takes 8d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The lightning ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

reactions.name: Multi-reaction
reactions.desc: Strahd can take up to three reactions per round, but only one per turn. If an effect or condition would prevent him from taking reactions, he loses one reaction instead.

reactions.name: Indomitable
reactions.desc: When a hostile creature ends its turn, Strahd can repeat the saving throw against one effect or condition currently affecting it. (This reaction has no effect if the effect or condition didn’t originally require him to fail a saving throw.)

reactions.name: Misty Step
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage, Strahd casts misty step.

reactions.name: Blindness/Deafness
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage from a melee attack, Strahd casts blindness/deafness (DC 20) against the attacker. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, the target is either blinded or deafened (Strahd's choice) for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends. A creature that fails its saving throw against the spell takes an additional 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

lair_actions.name: The Land
lair_actions.desc: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), if he's outdoors and the players have not yet reconsecrated the Swamp Fane, Strahd can take one of the following lair action options, or forgo using any of them in that round:

lair_actions.name: Control Water (requires Swamp Fane.)
lair_actions.desc: Strahd casts or uses control water without components or concentration.

lair_actions.name: Fog Cloud (requires Swamp Fane.)
lair_actions.desc: Strahd casts fog cloud at 5th level without components or concentration. While the fog remains, Strahd has blindsight out to its edges.

monsters.name: Strahd, the Soldier
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.languages: Abyssal, Common, Draconic, Elvish, Giant, Infernal

traits.name: Battlefield Awareness
traits.desc: Strahd has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws against effects that he can see or hear, such as traps and spells. Additionally, Strahd can't be disarmed.

traits.name: Close Quarters Fighter
traits.desc: Strahd doesn't have disadvantage on his ranged attack rolls when within 5 feet of a hostile creature.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Strahd regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 hit point and isn’t in sunlight. If he takes radiant damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of his next turn.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: Strahd can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving his hands free.

traits.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, Strahd takes 20 radiant damage at the start of his turn, and he has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

traits.name: Fast Grappler
traits.desc: Strahd does not have to spend extra movement to move a creature grappled by him if the grappled creature is the same size or smaller.

traits.name: Undead Nature
traits.desc: Strahd doesn't require air.

traits.name: Forbiddance
traits.desc: Strahd can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

traits.name: Chained to the Grave
traits.desc: Strahd cannot gain the benefits of a long rest except by resting in his coffin for eight consecutive hours between dawn and dusk.

traits.name: Children of the Night
traits.desc: Strahd can comprehend and verbally communicate with Barovian bats, rats, and wolves (including dire wolves), which obey his commands.

traits.name: Stake to the Heart
traits.desc: If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into Strahd’s heart while he is incapacitated in his coffin, he is paralyzed until the stake is removed.

traits.name: Dominion of the Mountain
traits.desc: While Strahd retains the power of the Mountain Fane, he is under the effect of a permanent nondetection spell.

traits.name: Dominion of the Swamp
traits.desc: While Strahd retains the power of the Swamp Fane, he can cast major image and move earth without components.

traits.name: Dominion of the Forest
traits.desc: While Strahd retains the power of the Forest Fane, he can cast beast sense and locate creature without components.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.desc: If Strahd is destroyed while he retains the power of at least one of the Fanes, he gains a new body in 24 hours, regaining all his hit points and phases and becoming active again. His new body appears within his coffin.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Strahd makes two attacks, only one of which can be an umbral net.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 5) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, Strahd can force it to succeed on a DC 20 Strength saving throw or be pushed 5 feet away and knocked prone.

actions.name: Umbral Net
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (2d6) necrotic damage and the target is restrained until the start of Strahd’s next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Thunderous Wave
bonus_actions.desc: Strahd slams the point of his sword into the ground, creating a shockwave. Each creature within 5 feet must make a DC 20 Strength saving throw or take 14 (3d8) thunder damage and be pushed 5 feet away. A creature that succeeds takes half damage and isn’t pushed.

bonus_actions.name: Dark Volley
bonus_actions.desc: Strahd conjures a rain of shadowy arrows to fall toward a point he can see within 120 feet. Each creature within a 10-foot radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on that point must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) necrotic damage on a failure or half as much damage on a success.

reactions.name: Multi-reaction
reactions.desc: Strahd can take up to three reactions per round, but only one per turn. If an effect or condition would prevent him from taking reactions, he loses one reaction instead.

reactions.name: Indomitable
reactions.desc: Trigger: A hostile creature ends its turn. Effect: Strahd can repeat the saving throw against one effect or condition currently affecting him.

reactions.name: Commander’s Retreat
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage from a melee attack, Strahd forces his attacker to succeed on a DC 20 Strength saving throw or be pushed 5 feet away. He can then immediately move up to his speed away from them without provoking opportunity attacks.

reactions.name: Vengeful Strike
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage from a spell or attack, Strahd moves up to his speed toward the attacker and can make a longsword attack against them. This movement doesn’t trigger opportunity attacks.

lair_actions.name: The Land
lair_actions.desc: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), if he's outdoors and the players have not yet reconsecrated the Swamp Fane, Strahd can take one of the following lair action options, or forgo using any of them in that round:

lair_actions.name: Plant Growth (Forest Fane Required)
lair_actions.desc: Strahd casts plant growth without components or concentration.

lair_actions.name: Wrath of Nature (Forest Fane Required)
lair_actions.desc: Strahd casts wrath of nature without components or concentration. When he casts it this way, he can’t use the spell’s rocks effect.

monsters.name: Strahd, the Vampire
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.languages: Abyssal, Common, Draconic, Elvish, Giant, Infernal

traits.name: Close Quarters Fighter
traits.desc: Strahd doesn't have disadvantage on his ranged attack rolls when within 5 feet of a hostile creature.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Strahd regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight. If he takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: Strahd can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving his hands free.

traits.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, Strahd takes 20 radiant damage at the start of his turn, and he has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

traits.name: Fast Grappler
traits.desc: Strahd does not have to spend extra movement to move a creature grappled by him if the grappled creature is the same size or smaller.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Strahd makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack. Strahd can replace one of his attacks with a charm.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, Strahd can grapple it (escape DC 20).

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature grappled by Strahd, incapacitated, or restrained. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by the necrotic damage taken, and Strahd regains hit points equal to that amount. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid reduced to 0 hit points by this damage and then buried rises the following sunset as a vampire spawn under Strahd's control. If the target hasn't been bitten within the last 24 hours, when finishing a long rest it can roll one of its hit dice and add its Constitution modifier to increase its maximum hit points (not exceeding its original maximum).

actions.name: Charm
actions.desc:
One humanoid within 30 feet that Strahd can see must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed for 1 minute or until Strahd loses concentration (as if concentrating on a spell).
A target that can't see Strahd automatically succeeds.
While charmed, the target regards Strahd as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected; it isn't under Strahd's control but takes his requests in the most favorable way and lets Strahd bite it.
The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
If still charmed at the end of the minute, the effect lasts for 24 hours, until Strahd is destroyed, or until he ends it as a bonus action.

bonus_actions.name: Bats' Frenzy
bonus_actions.desc: Each creature within 10 feet must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw or take 15 (6d4) necrotic damage and gain disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the start of Strahd's next turn. A creature that succeeds takes half damage and doesn't gain disadvantage.

bonus_actions.name: Predator's Fury
bonus_actions.desc: Strahd chooses up to two creatures within 60 feet that are within 5 feet of each other. A target must succeed on a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw or take 16 (2d10 + 5) force damage and be knocked prone. A creature that succeeds takes half damage and isn't knocked prone.

reactions.name: Multi-reaction
reactions.desc: Strahd can take up to three reactions per round, but only one per turn. If an effect would prevent him from taking reactions, he loses one reaction instead.

reactions.name: Indomitable
reactions.desc: Trigger: A hostile creature ends its turn. Effect: Strahd can repeat the saving throw against one effect currently affecting him.

reactions.name: Night's Retreat
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage, Strahd can fly up to his speed without provoking opportunity attacks and breaks free of grapples.

reactions.name: Blood Frenzy
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage, Strahd moves up to his speed toward the attacker and makes an unarmed strike.

lair_actions.name: The Land
lair_actions.desc: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), if he's outdoors and the players have not reconsecrated the Mountain Fane, Strahd can take one of the following lair action options.

lair_actions.name: Change Weather (Mountain Fane Required)
lair_actions.desc: Strahd casts control weather without concentration or components and may change any number of weather conditions to any stage.

lair_actions.name: Call Lightning (Mountain Fane Required)
lair_actions.desc: Strahd casts or uses call lightning without concentration or components. When outdoors in a storm, lightning damage from this spell deals maximum damage.
